meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the Oedipus complex.
meanings.sent1: The therapist discussed the oedipal feelings the patient had towards their parents.
meanings.sent2: The book delved into the oedipal themes present in the protagonist's relationships.
meanings.sent3: The sitcom humorously portrayed the oedipal struggles of a teenage character.
meanings.sent4: The movie used oedipal undertones to create tension between the main characters.
meanings.sent5: The painting vividly depicted the oedipal dynamics within the family.

meanings.definition: Involving a desire for sexual involvement with the parent of the opposite sex and a concomitant sense of rivalry with the parent of the same sex; relating to or characteristic of the Oedipus complex.
meanings.sent1: The novel explored the character's oedipal attraction to their mother.
meanings.sent2: The play depicted the oedipal conflict between the father and son.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie humorously portrayed an oedipal love triangle.
meanings.sent4: The song's lyrics used oedipal imagery to convey a sense of forbidden desire.
meanings.sent5: The dream had an oedipal theme, symbolizing unresolved family tensions.
